most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
Pasting in VS Code causes delay
Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
CTRL + V (Super + V) Doesn't work for Screenshots

common_issues.title: Pieces OS launch failures
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to launch, often manifesting as a white screen or connection issues.  Reinstallation doesn't consistently resolve the problem. Proposed solutions include updating to the latest app version, debugging with support, and checking for conflicting software.

related_issues.title: White screen on Windows 11
related_issues.text:
White screen on Windows 11
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Installed it yesterday and it was fine until it's a permanently blank screen today when I launch the Pieces Desktop app.

I reinstalled the entire suite multiple times and it's still the same.

![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/33184869/bfba2d65-0393-4ef6-b8f9-dc958201fe5d)

## GitHub Conversation Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @jiaweing is experiencing a white screen when using the Pieces Desktop Application.
* This issue is confirmed by other users, including @ubranch and @JeffreyMJohnson.

**Problems Identified:**

* The cause of the white screen is unclear.
* The issue persists even after reinstalling the application.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* @mack-at-pieces suggests trying the latest version of the app (3.1.0).
* @mack-at-pieces offers to debug the issue live with affected users.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is not resolved for some users.
* Debugging sessions are scheduled with @mack-at-pieces.

**Additional Information:**

* @ubranch expresses dissatisfaction with the Flutter stack used for the application.

**Note:** This summary focuses on the most recent information. For a complete picture, please refer to the original conversation.

**Current status/outcome:**

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Andrea3i is experiencing issues launching the Pieces OS toolbar, including from Visual Studio, the desktop app, and after restarting the computer.
* The log file shows an error related to the toolbar failing to launch.
* Robert-at-pieces identifies two potential issues: one related to the new Saved Materials webview and another related to port selection for webviews.

**Problems Identified:**

* The toolbar is not launching correctly.
* The Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.0 may have an issue with the new Saved Materials webview.
* The Pieces OS version may have an issue with port selection for webviews.
* The icon in the system tray does not launch the toolbar.
* Pieces OS restarts on its own.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.1 was released to resolve a UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 was released to change how ports are chosen for webviews.
* Scheduling a screen recording with the user to gather more information.
* Scheduling a call with the user to further debug the issue.
* Running a utility to return the OS error code.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The proposed solutions have not yet resolved the issue for Andrea3i.
* The root cause of the problem is still being investigated.
* A call is scheduled with the user to gather more information.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation indicates that the issue may be related to an OS error trying to host applets.
* Possible causes include lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, and account permission restrictions.
* The GitHub issue is still open and being actively investigated.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and VS Code extension issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS toolbar launch failures, VS Code extension errors, and performance slowdowns. Proposed solutions include plugin updates, port selection changes, and OS compatibility checks. Issues persist for some users, requiring further investigation.

related_issues.title: Pasting in VS Code causes delay
related_issues.text:
Pasting in VS Code causes delay
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Sometimes I notice pasting in VS Code causes a delay of around 2-5 seconds. When I disable Pieces it no longer occurs. Specifically, it is pasting anywhere within the code, not necessarily inside the chat assistant. If it happens frequently, I am forced to turn off pieces, otherwise workflow is significantly disrupted.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Avonbek reported a slowdown issue in the Pieces VS Code extension, specifically with the Ctrl+V paste command.
* Avonbek provided details on their VS Code version and OS.
* Avonbek tested the issue on different machines and confirmed it occurs on both Insiders and regular VS Code, but not consistently.
* Avonbek mentioned the possibility of the issue being related to their machine's specifications.

**Problems identified:**

* Slowdown experienced when using Ctrl+V paste command in the Pieces VS Code extension.
* Inconsistent occurrence of the issue.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Caleb suggested removing/rebinding the Ctrl+V key bind for the paste command in the VS Code extension as a temporary solution.
* Caleb offered to hop on a call with Avonbek to investigate the issue further.
* Avonbek planned to test the proposed solution and reach out if the issue persists.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Avonbek reported not experiencing the slowdown during an entire work session, suggesting the issue might be resolved.
* Caleb acknowledged the positive update and thanked Avonbek for keeping them informed. 

**Additional notes:**

* The cause of the slowdown remains unclear, potentially related to performance limitations or machine specifications. 
* Further investigation might be needed if the issue resurfaces.

related_issues.title: VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
related_issues.text:
VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.10

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Copilot side bar works fine but I haven't been able to find a setting to wrap lines especially in the responses code blocks.
Is there a setting for Pieces extension to wrap all text Markdown and Code Blocks??

See below, markdown text is wrapped but code block text isn't which for myself isn't ideal?
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eec00284-7ad3-4895-9969-d66488120d76)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** 
- The current code block functionality in Pieces OS does not allow line wrapping.
- This is problematic for users who want to create one-line scripts.

**Proposed Solution:**
- Implement line wrapping for code blocks.

**Status:**
- The feature has been added to the project board and is expected to be implemented in a future release of Pieces OS.

**Key Points:**
- Line wrapping for code blocks is a highly requested feature.
- It will improve the usability of code blocks for users creating one-line scripts.
- The feature is currently in the development pipeline.

Thank you in advance.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* Andrea3i is experiencing issues launching the Pieces OS toolbar, including from Visual Studio, the desktop app, and after restarting the computer.
* The log file shows an error related to the toolbar failing to launch.
* Robert-at-pieces identifies two potential issues: one related to the new Saved Materials webview and another related to port selection for webviews.

**Problems Identified:**

* The toolbar is not launching correctly.
* The Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.0 may have an issue with the new Saved Materials webview.
* The Pieces OS version may have an issue with port selection for webviews.
* The icon in the system tray does not launch the toolbar.
* Pieces OS restarts on its own.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.1 was released to resolve a UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 was released to change how ports are chosen for webviews.
* Scheduling a screen recording with the user to gather more information.
* Scheduling a call with the user to further debug the issue.
* Running a utility to return the OS error code.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The proposed solutions have not yet resolved the issue for Andrea3i.
* The root cause of the problem is still being investigated.
* A call is scheduled with the user to gather more information.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation indicates that the issue may be related to an OS error trying to host applets.
* Possible causes include lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, and account permission restrictions.
* The GitHub issue is still open and being actively investigated.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS crashes or gets stuck
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS crashing or getting stuck when launching or accessing features like "Discover Integrations." Issues involve potential GTK problems, webview port selection, and OS errors. Solutions include updating the Visual Studio plugin and Pieces OS, but further investigation and debugging are often needed.

related_issues.title: Crash on clicking on "Discover Integrations"
related_issues.text:
Crash on clicking on "Discover Integrations"
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When clicking the menu point "Discover Integrations" the pieces os crashes after a few seconds and needs to be restarted.

Menu: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/7874631/ee50cf5a-c02b-481f-af39-df96bd214437)
System Details: ![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/7874631/27dabc03-a33e-4b59-b496-86f532c8a56e)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* @Idrinth reported Pieces OS crashes when clicking the "Discover Integrations" button.
* Logs provided by @Idrinth showed no obvious problems.
* @mack-at-pieces confirmed the issue and noted its consistency.
* @nathan-courtney-pieces confirmed the issue and identified it as a potential GTK problem.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS crashes consistently when clicking the "Discover Integrations" button.
* The root cause of the crashes is currently unknown.
* It's suspected to be a GTK issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Currently, no specific solutions have been implemented.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is acknowledged and under investigation.
* @nathan-courtney-pieces will provide an update when a fix is found.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Integration Conflicts
common_issues.description: Users report conflicts between Pieces OS and other applications, particularly Firefox and Visual Studio, on Windows. Issues include nested processes, incorrect browser identification, and toolbar launch failures. Proposed solutions involve updating Pieces OS and its plugins, investigating port selection, and gathering user logs for analysis.

related_issues.title: FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
related_issues.text:
FireFox not functioning properly under WorkStream Pattern Engine
### Software

Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Clicking on any link within the Pieces desktop app that required a browser to open up, I would receive the message:
Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window.
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/706ac8c5-b939-4183-af48-ba573901f6ba)

After further review, it does appear that all instances of firefox are spawned under the Pieces OS service:
![image](https://github.com/pieces-app/support/assets/82057175/716495d0-b4aa-4bfa-b8d4-d0baf32c8984)

I know that disabling the WorkStream Pattern Engine, this is not an issue. (Assuming I kill off all processes of firefox under that task).


It makes me think that since Pieces OS is hijacking the process, and then firefox is trying to spawn the instance outside of that process, there is a conflict.


My default browser is set to firefox.

I'm running W11.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* TSCarterJr reports Firefox instances launching as nested processes within the Pieces for Developers app.
* This problem only occurs on Windows 11 Home, even with Explorer Patcher installed.
* The issue persists across restarts and doesn't occur with non-Insider Preview builds.

**Problems Identified:**

* Firefox instances launch as nested processes under Pieces for Developers, causing conflicts.
* Right-clicking the Pieces taskbar item shows incorrect behavior, indicating a misidentification as the browser.
* The problem is specific to Windows 11 Home and Insider Preview builds.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* nathan-courtney-pieces acknowledges the issue and plans to investigate its cause.
* No specific solutions have been implemented yet.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue persists and requires further investigation.
* The problem appears limited to Windows 11 Home and Insider Preview builds.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user, TSCarterJr, confirmed not being on a Windows Insider Preview build.
* The issue was initially discussed on Discord and internal GChat before being reported on GitHub.

* Andrea3i is experiencing issues launching the Pieces OS toolbar, including from Visual Studio, the desktop app, and after restarting the computer.
* The log file shows an error related to the toolbar failing to launch.
* Robert-at-pieces identifies two potential issues: one related to the new Saved Materials webview and another related to port selection for webviews.

**Problems Identified:**

* The toolbar is not launching correctly.
* The Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.0 may have an issue with the new Saved Materials webview.
* The Pieces OS version may have an issue with port selection for webviews.
* The icon in the system tray does not launch the toolbar.
* Pieces OS restarts on its own.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.1 was released to resolve a UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 was released to change how ports are chosen for webviews.
* Scheduling a screen recording with the user to gather more information.
* Scheduling a call with the user to further debug the issue.
* Running a utility to return the OS error code.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The proposed solutions have not yet resolved the issue for Andrea3i.
* The root cause of the problem is still being investigated.
* A call is scheduled with the user to gather more information.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation indicates that the issue may be related to an OS error trying to host applets.
* Possible causes include lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, and account permission restrictions.
* The GitHub issue is still open and being actively investigated.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Scrolling and Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report difficulties with scrolling during answer generation and connection problems. Scrolling improvements are being implemented, and users experiencing connection issues should contact support with logs for troubleshooting.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop does not scroll when answering
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

2.12.2

### Early Access Program

- [X] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When answering, the curser stays with the question, should move to the answer. Requires clicking the arrow-down symbol to the end and then fine-navigating to the begin of the answer.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* **Scrolling behavior:** User expects continuous scrolling as the text is being generated.
* **Distinguishing responses:** User wants to be able to distinguish different refining outputs.
* **Two-pane approach:** User suggests a two-pane approach for refining prompts (like CodeConvert.ai and Phind).
* **Scrolling issues:** User can't scroll up during answer generation, preventing them from reading earlier parts.

**Problems identified:**

* Current scrolling behavior is inconsistent and doesn't meet user expectations.
* No clear distinction between different refining outputs.
* Two-pane approach not implemented.
* Difficulty scrolling up during answer generation.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Continuous scrolling as the answer is generated.
* Distinguishing different refining outputs (implementation details not provided).
* Two-pane approach for refining prompts - not implemented.
* Improvement in scrolling behavior.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Solutions proposed for scrolling behavior and distinguishing outputs.
* Two-pane approach not implemented.
* Latest version includes scrolling improvements, but user feedback is needed.

**Additional notes:**

* The latest version of the software should be tested to see if the scrolling issues are resolved.
* There is no information on whether the two-pane approach will be implemented.

related_issues.title: VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
related_issues.text:
VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.10

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Copilot side bar works fine but I haven't been able to find a setting to wrap lines especially in the responses code blocks.
Is there a setting for Pieces extension to wrap all text Markdown and Code Blocks??

See below, markdown text is wrapped but code block text isn't which for myself isn't ideal?
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eec00284-7ad3-4895-9969-d66488120d76)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Issue:** 
- The current code block functionality in Pieces OS does not allow line wrapping.
- This is problematic for users who want to create one-line scripts.

**Proposed Solution:**
- Implement line wrapping for code blocks.

**Status:**
- The feature has been added to the project board and is expected to be implemented in a future release of Pieces OS.

**Key Points:**
- Line wrapping for code blocks is a highly requested feature.
- It will improve the usability of code blocks for users creating one-line scripts.
- The feature is currently in the development pipeline.

recommendations: "Investigate Pieces OS launch failures: This is the most common issue with 3 related tickets. Focus on solutions like app updates, debugging, and compatibility checks."
"Address Pieces OS and VS Code extension issues: Another common problem with 3 tickets. Explore plugin updates, port selection, and OS compatibility as potential solutions."
"Prioritize tickets 474, 258, and 271: These are the most active tickets, indicating a high urgency for resolution."
"Improve communication for tickets with connection problems: Request user logs and provide clear troubleshooting steps."
"Gather more data on scrolling issues: While improvements are being made, continue monitoring user feedback to ensure a smooth experience."
